titleStmt.title: The tragedy of King Richard the third Containing, his treacherous plots against his brother Clarence: the pittiefull murther of his iunocent [sic] nephewes: his tyrannicall vsurpation: with the whole course of his detested life, and most deserued death. As it hath beene lately acted by the Right honourable the Lord Chamberlaine his seruants.
King Richard III
titleStmt.author: Shakespeare, William, 1564-1616.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Valentine Simmes [and Peter Short], for Andrew Wise, dwelling in Paules Chuch-yard [sic], at the signe of the Angell,

notesStmt.note: "Quires A-G pr[inted]. by Simmes; the rest by Short"--STC.
Running title reads: The tragedy of Richard the third.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

place.placeName: Paules Chuch-yard [sic], at the signe of the Angell
